descriptions.content:
Volitional verbs are concerned with controllable action, and are compatible with intentional auxiliaries such as པ་ཡིན་ and “jussive” suffixes that convey an order or a suggestion (such as ཏ་ or ཤིག་). Moreover, these verbs sometimes have a special inflected form for the imperative.

Some basic examples of volitional verbs are:

  • བལྟས་པ་ཡིན། “I looked.”
  • ལྟོས་ཤིག “Look!”
  • ཉལ་པ་ཡིན། “I went to bed.”
  • ཉོལ་ཤིག “Go to bed! Lie down!”
